image.altText: A close-up portrait of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: Aboriginal rights trailblazer Margaret Tucker is among a group of remarkable women chosen in a bid to improve gender representation in Victoria's public art.

title.children: Victorian trailblazers to be immortalised with public artworks

image.altText: Road sign towards Avalon airport and precinct with car driving past.

props.synopsis: Police say a teenager allegedly entered Avalon Airport through a hole in the security fence before he boarded a Jetstar flight armed with a loaded shotgun.

title.children: Security at regional airports under microscope after major security breach

image.altText: Frida Kahlo self-portrait of woman wearing a thorn necklace with a monkey on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Some of Frida Kahlo's clothing was kept under lock and key for 50 years. Now, garments holding "little traces of her daily life" will be on display in regional Victoria.

title.children: Kahlo clothing exhibit goes beyond the 'face with the flower crown'

image.altText: Benjamin Klein inside the Adass Israel Synagogue, standing in a room surrounded with fire-damaged walls.

props.synopsis: In the months after the December attack that devastated Melbourne's Jewish community, the synagogue's congregation has rallied, finding a makeshift place to pray and fundraising for the eventual rebuild of the site.

title.children: Melbourne synagogue congregation plans rebuild while waiting for justice

image.altText: A shitless young man and two young women with long hair stand in a rural area on a clear day.

props.synopsis: The festival is the biggest event on the calendar for the town of Donald, but after a late cancellation the blame game is underway.

title.children: Esoteric Festival cancellation leaves thousands stranded in tiny town

image.altText: A young basketballer on court, smiling

props.synopsis: Alier Riak's parents have remembered their son as a talented basketballer and role model for children.

title.children: Brothers jailed for 25 years for fatal stabbing of young basketballer in Melbourne

image.altText: Man tackling youth to floor of plane

props.synopsis: Shearing contractor Barry Clark arrived in Sydney on Friday to cheers from Jetstar staff, thanking him for his quick actions to subdue a 17-year-old who allegedly had a shotgun.

title.children: Shearer who tackled alleged gun-wielding teen gets hero's welcome

image.altText: A man photographed anonymously in his house, who uses ketamine

props.synopsis: Officers allege the trio was involved in importing a quantity of ketamine worth $1.2 million.

title.children: Police arrest three men in alleged drug trafficking ring in Victoria

image.altText: A man gives a cow lying on the ground a drink of water from a water bottle.

props.synopsis: Dead and injured cattle from an overturned livestock truck were ignored by authorities for weeks while multiple state government agencies, councils, and insurance companies bickered over who was responsible.

title.children: Response to cattle truck rollover branded a bureaucratic 'balls-up'

image.altText: An internal view of the Metro Tunnel.

props.synopsis: Two CFMEU delegates have been sacked amid allegations a labour hire company paid wages for shifts that were never worked in a scam that could potentially have cost millions of dollars.

title.children: Investigation into alleged Melbourne Metro Tunnel 'ghost shifts' scam

image.altText: A person standing at a desk in Parliament House speaking next to a panel of others.

props.synopsis: A coalition of more than 160 organisations launches a national campaign urging politicians to do more to give young people facing homelessness a fairer shot at housing.

title.children: Atlas survived homelessness — now they want a fairer shot at housing

image.altText: AFL captains sit together for a photo, with the premiership cup between Lachie Neale and Callum Mills

props.synopsis: As a new footy season arrives, fresh with promise and hope for clubs and fans across the country, the AFL braces for a year set to be dominated by discussions of concussion, drugs and trade and free agency speculation.

title.children: The AFL braces for 2025, a season that could change the game forever

image.altText: A smiling young woman in gloves and an evening gown.

props.synopsis: Bella Canfield, 18, died when she was hit by a car while walking her dog on the road near her Victorian home in 2022.

title.children: Driver found not guilty of teen's death outside family home

image.altText: A black and white photo of children at a swimming pool

props.synopsis: More than half of the state's municipal pools are over 50 years old and reaching their end of life, and councils warn more help is needed to keep them afloat.

title.children: More than half of Victoria's old public pools in danger of closing

image.altText: Judy Ann-Thomas standing in front flowers at her florist in Cheltenham.

props.synopsis: Some Cheltenham residents say 18-storey apartment buildings around future Suburban Rail Loop stations will change the character of their quiet neighbourhood, but traders say they'd welcome the boost to business.

title.children: In this Melbourne 'village', views are split on a high-rise future

image.altText: A designed image showing Peter Dutton, Anthony Albanese and Fiona Phillips standing together with the text "Compare the pair".

props.synopsis: Ousted CFMEU officials are targeting Labor MPs in marginal electorates with social media attack ads that political analysts say could help the Coalition pick up seats in this year's federal election.

title.children: Ousted CFMEU officials funding ads attacking Labor in marginal seats

image.altText: trucks and cars on highway

props.synopsis: Labor announces a $1.1 billion Western Highway upgrade, with most of the funding to go towards improving the freeway between Melton and Caroline Springs.

title.children: Labor pitches $1b freeway upgrade to Melbourne's west ahead of election

image.altText: A man sitting on a desk

props.synopsis: Police allege the 39-year-old man filmed underneath the skirts of around 150 girls in Ballarat and Melbourne and may face up to 300 charges altogether.

title.children: Ballarat man faces court over alleged 'upskirt' images of girls

props.synopsis: Police acknowledge an "uptick in street offending", but caution residents against social media vigilantism and taking matters into their own hands.

title.children: A 'horrific' crime wave in Bendigo is fuelling vigilantism — but police say it's not the answer

image.altText: Kai Lohmann and Cam Rayner of the Lions celebrate with the premiership cup in front of cheering fans

props.synopsis: The 2025 AFL season looks set to be desperately hard to separate the cream from the crop, with no side flawless, and almost every team harbouring hopes of playing footy in September.

title.children: Unpredictable AFL season 2025 set to be most open in years

image.altText: A man in uniform and hi-vis approaches a teenager

props.synopsis: A court has heard the alleged ringleader of an attack on a security guard in a regional shopping centre considers himself a risk to society.

title.children: Alleged teen 'prime mover' denied bail after attack on guard

image.altText: A group of people stand on parliament stairs in Melbourne with placards.

props.synopsis: The Albury hospital redevelopment is set to cost the state and federal governments more than $500 million, but critics say it will still be below par.

title.children: Border town residents warn hospital plans will put lives at risk

image.altText: A woman standing outside of a caravan wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Recent research by the Grattan Institute has found the number of older Australians unable to afford rent is growing, and women are disproportionately affected.

title.children: Australia's hidden homeless seek shelter outside the system

image.altText: Cars on a country road. Smoke is visible in the distance.

props.synopsis: Authorities are fighting two fires near Ballarat that have forced the evacuation of a primary school and closed multiple businesses.

title.children: Two fires burning around Ballarat now contained

image.altText: A man sits at a desk with two computer screens behind him.

props.synopsis: The first question your GP asks at your next appointment could be "do you mind if artificial intelligence listens along?"

title.children: Concerns for sensitive patient data as GPs adopt AI scribes

image.altText: A woman with long black hair in a black singlet top stand beside a colourful brick wall and stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: It's still not known how many students have been caught up in the business failure, whether they've lost their savings or if they can still come to Australia.

title.children: 'Everything was crumbling': Inside international student agency's collapse

image.altText: The AFL logo on the side of a building, partially obscured by a tree branch.

props.synopsis: Saturday used to be the home of footy but in 2025 fans better get used to paying to watch AFL on a Saturday, when most matches are traditionally played.

title.children: Saturday night's not alright as AFL games disappear from free-to-air

image.altText: Three long white boxes with wires and tech inside.

props.synopsis: In 2022, a Melbourne start-up announced they’d taught neurons in a dish to play Pong. Now, they’re selling a "biological computer" made of thousands of human neurons.

title.children: Melbourne start-up launches 'biological computer' made of human brain cells

image.altText: Sam Mitchell talks to his team

props.synopsis: Hawthorn coach Sam Mitchell says they learned a lot from last season as they returned to the AFL finals — especially the need for further improvement.

title.children: Hawks fuelled by 'a little bit of rage' this AFL season

image.altText: A man with grey hair in a grey jumper over a blue collared shirt stands on a rocky beach on a sunny day near a building site.

props.synopsis: A man who oversaw the construction of a concrete seawall in front of his beachfront mansion without a permit has vowed to tear it down and rehabilitate the section of beach it was built on.

title.children: Man behind Frankston Beach seawall vows to tear it down and 'move out'

image.altText: A mosquito sucks blood from someone's forearm

props.synopsis: Authorities confirm a second human case of Japanese encephalitis in a person from northern Victoria, likely exposed in the Riverina region of NSW along the Murray River.

title.children: Second Victorian case of Japanese encephalitis recorded in Riverina visitor

image.altText: A man in a headdress and reflective sunglasses raises a fist as he and other dance in a country area.

props.synopsis: A Victorian music festival has been given the green light to go ahead this weekend despite council officers recommending it be shut down.

title.children: Victorian music festival gets green light despite health, safety fears

image.altText: Charles Williams wears a red visitors lanyard as he directs Guy Pearce in the film Inside.

props.synopsis: Inside — starring Guy Pearce, Cosmo Jarvis and teen newcomer Vincent Miller — is the result of years of research into Victoria's corrections system and its director's own life experiences.

title.children: Charles thought he'd end up in jail. Now he's directing Guy Pearce

image.altText: An ankle monitor bracelet

props.synopsis: Education Minister Ben Carroll says the proposal to place teenage criminals in public high schools will never occur under his watch.

title.children: Victoria ditches plan to send young offenders to school with ankle bracelets

image.altText: Vincent Fantauzzo

props.synopsis: When artist Vincent Fantauzzo first appeared on Australian Story, he held back some uncomfortable truths. Now he's ready to unveil it all.

title.children: Artist Vincent Fantauzzo dropped a truth bomb at his father's funeral
